meanings.definition: To accompany or be a companion to someone.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys companioning her elderly neighbor on walks.
meanings.sent2: I will be companioning my friend to the doctor's appointment.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to be companioning the cat around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The moon companioning the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog companioning its owner through thick and thin.

meanings.definition: The act of providing companionship or support to someone.
meanings.sent1: Her companioning of the new student helped him feel welcome.
meanings.sent2: Companioning can make a big difference in someone's life.
meanings.sent3: The robot's companioning of the astronaut was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The tree's companioning shade shielded the hikers from the sun.
meanings.sent5: The volunteer's companioning brought comfort to the patients in the hospital.

meanings.definition: The state of being a companion or friend to someone.
meanings.sent1: Their companioning was evident in the way they laughed together.
meanings.sent2: Companioning is essential for emotional well-being.
meanings.sent3: The cat's companioning of the mouse was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The sun's companioning warmth embraced the earth.
meanings.sent5: The book's companioning of the reader took them on a journey of imagination.
